intro: Crotalaria mocubensis, commonly known as the African spurred tortoise plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive spurred flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb with compound leaves and yellow or orange flowers. It is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is often found in disturbed habitats. Crotalaria mocubensis is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
